definitions.definition: Force (a hunted animal) to take refuge in a tree.
definitions.example: Last week residents of midtown Palo Alto, California, were warned of a cougar on the prowl in their neighborhood, where another big cat was treed and shot last May.

definitions.definition: A woody perennial plant, typically having a single stem or trunk growing to a considerable height and bearing lateral branches at some distance from the ground.
definitions.example: At the same time, branch-cutting was encouraged to get the tree to grow a single, main trunk.

definitions.definition: A wooden structure or part of a structure.
A thing that has a branching structure resembling that of a tree.
definitions.example: Both structure-based trees are moderately resolved with very short internal branches.
